E-Z LOKâ„¢ Tap - HSS - STI - Bottoming - M24-3.0

Screw thread insert taps (STI taps) operate in the same manner as â€œstandardâ€� taps, but produce an oversized thread specifically for E-Z Coilâ„¢ threaded inserts.

During insert installation, the threads cut by an STI tap form the E-Z Coilâ„¢ insert into the desired thread size. STI taps are ideal for tapping holes in softer metals that require a strong threaded insert.

E-Z LOKâ€™s E-Z Coilâ„¢ STI taps are manufactured from high speed steel (HSS) for superior durability. We offer STI taps in a wide range of inch, metric, and spark plug sizes to meet your unique requirements.

Features

  • These are taps that will produce a larger than nominal size threaded hole to accommodate a helical screw thread insert. A variety of styles are available to tap holes in soft materials where a strong threaded insert is desired.

Applications:

<div>
  <ul><li>Preparing a slightly larger thread for installation of E-Z Coil</li>
  </ul>
</div>

E-Z LOKâ„¢ Drill - Brad Point - HSS - 15/32

Brad Point drills are the go-to solution for drilling clean, accurate holes in both hard and soft woods.

Features

  • Brad Point drills are a cross between a regular twist drill and a spade bit.
  • Sharp tip at the end keeps the drill from wandering.
  • Tip also makes it easy to accurately position the drill
  • Can be used in either handled drill or drill press.

Applications:

Quickly and cleanly drilling the hole for insert installation.

E-Z Coilâ„¢ Threaded Insert for Metal - 2-56 x 1D

E-Z Coilâ„¢ inserts â€“ also known as wire or helical threaded inserts â€“ quickly repair or reinforce tapped holes in soft metals. Made from 18-8 stainless steel wire, E-Z Coilâ„¢ inserts provide strong internal threads that are corrosion resistant and withstand temperatures to 800Â°F.

E-Z Coilâ„¢ inserts are made of 18-8 stainless steel wire. The wire is formed into a diamond pattern and then wound into a spring. Before being installed, the insert diameter is larger than the tapped hole. The insert diameter is reduced during installation, allowing the insert to thread into the hole. Once properly installed, the radial pressure of the released insert holds the insert firmly in place.

Features

  • Quickly repair damaged threads in soft metal
  • Protect tapped holes from stripping and wear
  • Made from corrosion resistant 18-8 stainless steel

Applications:

  • Soft metals: aluminum, cast iron, magnesium, etc.

E-Z Finâ„¢ Threaded Insert for Soft Wood or Plastic - Single fin - 6-32

E-Z Finâ„¢ (Finserts) provide strong, metal threads in soft woods, like pine, composition board, and MDF, and most plastics. Firm, permanent fastening is achieved by distributing stress over a greater surface area, minimizing the possibility of splintering, splitting, and thread erosion.

Machined out of brass, E-Z Finâ„¢ (Finserts) are available in single, double or triple fin designs for varying material thicknesses. Internal threads sizes range from #6 to 5/16.

Important Note: Hole size requirements may vary depending on a number of factors, including material and tools. We recommend that you test your particular application before ordering. We gladly supply free samples.

Features

  • Easy press-in installation
  • Design minimizes splintering and splitting
  • Available in 3 lengths for varying material thicknesses

Applications:

  • Soft woods: such as pine, composition board, and MDF
  • Most Plastics

Important Note: Hole size requirements may vary depending on a number of factors, including material and tools. We recommend that you test your particular application before ordering. We gladly supply free samples.

Features

  • Easy press-in installation
  • Design minimizes splintering and splitting
  • Available in 3 lengths for varying material thicknesses

Applications:

  • Soft woods: such as pine, composition board, and MDF
  • Most Plastics

E-Z Hexâ„¢ Threaded Insert for Soft Wood - Flush - M4-0.7 x 10mm

Generically referred to as Type D (flanged) or Type E (flush) insert nuts, E-Z Hexâ„¢ (Hex Drive) inserts provide sturdy machine threads in soft woods. These hex drives are an ideal solution for any application where assembly or disassembly could lead to thread erosion or stripping.

E-Z Hexâ„¢ inserts feature broad external threads that provide exceptional holding power in materials like pine, composition board, MDF, and plywood. We offer E-Z Hexâ„¢ with internal thread sizes ranging from #8 to 3/8-16, and M4 to M10. Die-cast from a durable zinc alloy, E-Z Hexâ„¢ inserts install quickly with an Allen wrench or optional drive tool.

Most sizes are available in a variety of lengths to meet the needs of your unique application.

Features

  • Inexpensive solution for reinforcing threads in soft woods
  • Install with Allen wrench or optional drive tool
  • Inch or metric threads available
  • Flush and flanged designs available
  • Multiple lengths available

  • Drawer Pulls
  • Display Cases

Everything needed to repair or reinforce threaded holes in wood in a convenient, easy-to-order kit.

Easy to use soution for putting strong, machine threads in soft wood.

Features

E-Z Knifeâ„¢ Threaded Insert for Hard Wood - Stainless Steel - 4-40

E-Z Knifeâ„¢ inserts are designed for use in hard woods, like oak, cherry, and maple. E-Z Knifeâ„¢ inserts are ideal for use wherever assembly or disassembly could lead to thread erosion or stripping. Also, E-Z Knifeâ„¢ inserts for wood use a proprietary external â€œknifeâ€� thread to slice into the wood, which provides superior holding power.

E-Z Knifeâ„¢ inserts are most often machined out of brass when internal thread sizes range from #4 to 3/8 or M3 to M8. For additional corrosion resistance, stainless steel knife thread inserts are used with 8-32, 10-24, and 1/4-20 internal threads.

Features

  • Superior holding power in hard wood
  • Sizing variety, inch (coarse/fine) & metric
  • Brass or stainless steel options
  • Easily installs with a screwdriver, bolt/jam nut, or optional drive tool

Applications:

  • Cabinetry & Furniture
  • Partitions
  • Display Cases
  • Beer Tap Handles
  • Shipping Containers
  • Anywhere a fastener will be used in wood

Installation:

E-Z Knife threaded inserts are typically installed with the slots up. The slots accommodate a screwdriver or E-Z LOK drive tool. For harder woods, screwdriver installation isn't practical. Installation can be accomplished with the drive tool or using a bolt and jam nuts. When using the bolt/jam nuts installation technique, the slotted end of the insert can be either up or down.

E-Z Knifeâ„¢ inserts are ideal for use wherever assembly or disassembly could lead to thread erosion or stripping. Also, E-Z Knifeâ„¢ inserts for wood use a proprietary external â€œknifeâ€� thread to slice into the wood, which provides superior holding power.

E-Z Knifeâ„¢ inserts are most often machined out of brass when internal thread sizes range from #4 to 3/8 or M3 to M8. For additional corrosion resistance, stainless steel knife thread inserts are used with 8-32, 10-24, and 1/4-20 internal threads.

Features

  • Superior hard wood holding power
  • Sizing variety, inch (coarse/fine) & metric
  • Brass or stainless steel options
  • Easily installs with a screwdriver, bolt/jam nut, or optional drive tool
  • Easily installs with a screwdriver, bolt/jam nut, or optional drive tool

Applications:

  • Cabinetry & Furniture
  • Partitions
  • Display Cases
  • Beer Tap Handles
  • Shipping Containers
  • Anywhere a fastener will be used in wood

Installation:

E-Z Knife threaded inserts are typically installed with the slots up. The slots accommodate a screwdriver or E-Z LOK drive tool. For harder woods, screwdriver installation isn't practical. Installation can be accomplished with the drive tool or using a bolt and jam nuts. When using the bolt/jam nuts installation technique, the slotted end of the insert can be either up or down.

E-Z Knife threaded inserts are typically installed with the slots up. The slots accommodate a screwdriver or E-Z LOK drive tool. For harder woods, screwdriver installation isn't practical. Installation can be accomplished with the drive tool or using a bolt and jam nuts. When using the bolt/jam nuts installation technique, the slotted end of the insert can be either up or down.

E-Z LOKâ„¢ Threaded Insert for Metal - Standard Wall - 303 Stainless - 4-40 x 10-32

STRONG THREADS MADE EASY

All solid construction E-Z LOK threaded inserts install with standard tools. No special drills...no special taps...no special installation tools.

E-Z LOK external threads are standard size and pitch to permit the use of standard drills and taps. E-Z LOKs can be installed with a screwdriver, bolt/jam nut (except IC series), or optional power drive tool.

E-Z LOKs will not back out or vibrate loose. Immediately upon installation, microencapsulated adhesive begins to set and the newly installed inserts are fastener-ready in 3-5 minutes.

The adhesive seals against liquids and gases to 6,000 psi when fully cured (72 hours).

Features

  • Easy to install: solid threaded inserts install with standard tools, simply drill, tap and thread like any ordinary fastener (no special taps or installation tools are necessary)
  • Strength: carbon steel solid threaded inserts are screw machined out of solid steel for a stronger overall product
  • Standard OD Threads: solid threaded inserts for metal permit the use of standard drills and taps
  • Self-Locking: pre-applied adhesive activates upon installation
  • Vibration Resistant: adhesive secures the carbon steel solid threaded insert into place so it wonâ€™t back out
  • Seals against Liquids/Gases: solid threaded inserts are pressurized up to 6,000 psi.

Applications:

  • Soft metals: aluminum, cast iron, magnesium, etc.

Installation:

E-Z LOKâ„¢ Threaded Insert for Metal - Thin Wall - 303 Stainless - 6-32 x 12-28 x 0.280" OAL

E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) Thin Wall inserts offer the advantages of E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) Standard Wall threaded inserts while using a hole size virtually the same as E-Z Coilâ„¢ inserts.

Ideal for applications where thread insert size and weight are an issue, Thin Wall threaded inserts pack all the traditional E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) advantages into a smaller diameter design. Available with internal thread sizes from #10 to 1/2 and M4 to M12, E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) Thin Wall threaded inserts install with standard tools.

E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) Thin Wall solid threaded inserts use a modified external thread to reduce the hole diameter needed to achieve the desired internal thread size. To achieve this size reduction, these inserts have an oversized minor diameter on the OD thread. This provides sufficient wall thickness to maintain insert integrity, but does necessitate the use of a drill that is larger than typically used with the corresponding tap.

For example, a Standard Wall insert with a 5/8-11 external thread (7/16-14 ID) requires the use of a 17/32 drill. A Thin Wall insert with a 5/8-11 external thread (1/2-13 ID) requires the use of a 37/64 drill.

E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) Thin Wall inserts are self-locking. Immediately upon installation, pre-applied LOCTITEâ„¢ on the external threads begins to set and the newly installed insert is fastener ready in minutes. At full cure (72 hours), the Loctiteâ„¢ seals against liquids and gases to pressures of 6,000 psi.

Features

  • Ideal for applications where hole size is an issue
  • All the advantages of the standard E-Z LOK threaded inserts in a smaller overall diameter
  • Use standard tools for installation
  • Self-locking â€“ preapplied LOCTITEâ„¢ adhesive activates on installation
  • Vibration Resistant: adhesive secures the insert in place so it wonâ€™t back out
  • Vibration Resistant: adhesive secures the insert in place so it wonâ€™t back out

E-Z LOKâ„¢ Threaded Insert for Metal - Thin Wall - 303 Stainless - 1/4-20 x 3/8-24 x 0.375" OAL

E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) Thin Wall inserts offer the advantages of E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) Standard Wall threaded inserts while using a hole size virtually the same as E-Z Coilâ„¢ inserts.

Ideal for applications where thread insert size and weight are an issue, Thin Wall threaded inserts pack all the traditional E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) advantages into a smaller diameter design. Available with internal thread sizes from #10 to 1/2 and M4 to M12, E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) Thin Wall threaded inserts install with standard tools.

E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) Thin Wall solid threaded inserts use a modified external thread to reduce the hole diameter needed to achieve the desired internal thread size. To achieve this size reduction, these inserts have an oversized minor diameter on the OD thread. This provides sufficient wall thickness to maintain insert integrity, but does necessitate the use of a drill that is larger than typically used with the corresponding tap.

For example, a Standard Wall insert with a 5/8-11 external thread (7/16-14 ID) requires the use of a 17/32 drill. A Thin Wall insert with a 5/8-11 external thread (1/2-13 ID) requires the use of a 37/64 drill.

E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) Thin Wall inserts are self-locking. Immediately upon installation, pre-applied LOCTITEâ„¢ on the external threads begins to set and the newly installed insert is fastener ready in minutes. At full cure (72 hours), the Loctiteâ„¢ seals against liquids and gases to pressures of 6,000 psi.

Features

  • Ideal for applications where hole size is an issue
  • All the advantages of the standard E-Z LOK threaded inserts in a smaller overall diameter
  • Use standard tools for installation
  • Self-locking â€“ preapplied LOCTITEâ„¢ adhesive activates on installation
  • Vibration Resistant: adhesive secures the insert in place so it wonâ€™t back out
  • Vibration Resistant: adhesive secures the insert in place so it wonâ€™t back out

Applications:

  • Soft metals: aluminum, cast iron, magnesium, etc.

E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) Thin Wall inserts offer the advantages of E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) Standard Wall threaded inserts while using a hole size virtually the same as E-Z Coilâ„¢ inserts.

Ideal for applications where thread insert size and weight are an issue, Thin Wall threaded inserts pack all the traditional E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) advantages into a smaller diameter design. Available with internal thread sizes from #10 to 1/2 and M4 to M12, E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) Thin Wall threaded inserts install with standard tools.

E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) Thin Wall solid threaded inserts use a modified external thread to reduce the hole diameter needed to achieve the desired internal thread size. To achieve this size reduction, these inserts have an oversized minor diameter on the OD thread. This provides sufficient wall thickness to maintain insert integrity, but does necessitate the use of a drill that is larger than typically used with the corresponding tap.

For example, a Standard Wall insert with a 5/8-11 external thread (7/16-14 ID) requires the use of a 17/32 drill. A Thin Wall insert with a 5/8-11 external thread (1/2-13 ID) requires the use of a 37/64 drill.

E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) Thin Wall inserts are self-locking. Immediately upon installation, pre-applied LOCTITEâ„¢ on the external threads begins to set and the newly installed insert is fastener ready in minutes. At full cure (72 hours), the Loctiteâ„¢ seals against liquids and gases to pressures of 6,000 psi.

Features

  • Ideal for applications where hole size is an issue
  • All the advantages of the standard E-Z LOK threaded inserts in a smaller overall diameter
  • Use standard tools for installation
  • Self-locking â€“ preapplied LOCTITEâ„¢ adhesive activates on installation
  • Vibration Resistant: adhesive secures the insert in place so it wonâ€™t back out
  • Vibration Resistant: adhesive secures the insert in place so it wonâ€™t back out

Applications:

  • Soft metals: aluminum, cast iron, magnesium, etc.

Installation:

Unlike E-Z Coilâ„¢ inserts, which require a special tap and installation tool, E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) threaded inserts for metal are installed using standard tools, and installation is as easy as 1-2-3.

  • Simply drill the appropriately sized hole with a standard drill
  • Tap the hole with a standard tap
  • Turn in the E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) insert like an ordinary fastener with a screwdriver, bolt and jam nut, or an E-Z LOKâ„¢ drive tool.


E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) threaded inserts are self-locking and open immediately upon installation. The pre-applied LOCTITEâ„¢ on the external threads sets immediately allowing for the newly installed insert to be fastener ready.

E-Z LOK solid wall threaded inserts are typically installed with the slots up. The slots accommodate a screwdriver or E-Z LOK drive tool. When using a bolt and jam nuts for installation, the slotted end of the insert can be either up or down.

Important Note: Hole size requirements may vary depending on a number of factors, including material and tools. We recommend you test your particular application before ordering. Contact us for free samples.

E-Z LOKâ„¢ Threaded Insert for Metal - Standard Wall - 316 Stainless - 4-40 x 10-32

Strong Threads Made Easy

All solid construction E-Z LOK threaded inserts install with standard tools. No special drills...no special taps...no special installation tools.

E-Z LOK external threads are standard size and pitch to permit the use of standard drills and taps. E-Z LOKs can be installed with a screwdriver, bolt/jam nut (except IC series), or optional power drive tool.

E-Z LOKs will not back out or vibrate loose. Immediately upon installation, microencapsulated adhesive begins to set and the newly installed inserts are fastener-ready in 3-5 minutes.

The adhesive seals against liquids and gases to 6,000 psi when fully cured (72 hours).

E-Z LOKâ„¢ Threaded Insert for Metal - Thin Wall - Carbon Steel - 10-24 x 5/16-18

E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) Thin Wall inserts offer the advantages of E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) Standard Wall threaded inserts while using a hole size virtually the same as E-Z Coilâ„¢ inserts.

Ideal for applications where thread insert size and weight are an issue, Thin Wall threaded inserts pack all the traditional E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) advantages into a smaller diameter design. Available with internal thread sizes from #10 to 1/2 and M4 to M12, E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) Thin Wall threaded inserts install with standard tools.

E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) Thin Wall solid threaded inserts use a modified external thread to reduce the hole diameter needed to achieve the desired internal thread size. To achieve this size reduction, these inserts have an oversized minor diameter on the OD thread. This provides sufficient wall thickness to maintain insert integrity, but does necessitate the use of a drill that is larger than typically used with the corresponding tap.

For example, a Standard Wall insert with a 5/8-11 external thread (7/16-14 ID) requires the use of a 17/32 drill. A Thin Wall insert with a 5/8-11 external thread (1/2-13 ID) requires the use of a 37/64 drill.

E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) Thin Wall inserts are self-locking. Immediately upon installation, pre-applied LOCTITEâ„¢ on the external threads begins to set and the newly installed insert is fastener ready in minutes. At full cure (72 hours), the Loctiteâ„¢ seals against liquids and gases to pressures of 6,000 psi.

Features

  • Ideal for applications where hole size is an issue
  • All the advantages of the standard E-Z LOK threaded inserts in a smaller overall diameter
  • Use standard tools for installation
  • Self-locking â€“ preapplied LOCTITEâ„¢ adhesive activates on installation
  • Vibration Resistant: adhesive secures the insert in place so it wonâ€™t back out
  • Vibration Resistant: adhesive secures the insert in place so it wonâ€™t back out

E-Z LOKâ„¢ Threaded Insert for Metal - Thin Wall - Carbon Steel - 3/8-16 x 1/2-13

E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) Thin Wall inserts offer the advantages of E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) Standard Wall threaded inserts while using a hole size virtually the same as E-Z Coilâ„¢ inserts.

Ideal for applications where thread insert size and weight are an issue, Thin Wall threaded inserts pack all the traditional E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) advantages into a smaller diameter design. Available with internal thread sizes from #10 to 1/2 and M4 to M12, E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) Thin Wall threaded inserts install with standard tools.

E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) Thin Wall solid threaded inserts use a modified external thread to reduce the hole diameter needed to achieve the desired internal thread size. To achieve this size reduction, these inserts have an oversized minor diameter on the OD thread. This provides sufficient wall thickness to maintain insert integrity, but does necessitate the use of a drill that is larger than typically used with the corresponding tap.

For example, a Standard Wall insert with a 5/8-11 external thread (7/16-14 ID) requires the use of a 17/32 drill. A Thin Wall insert with a 5/8-11 external thread (1/2-13 ID) requires the use of a 37/64 drill.

E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) Thin Wall inserts are self-locking. Immediately upon installation, pre-applied LOCTITEâ„¢ on the external threads begins to set and the newly installed insert is fastener ready in minutes. At full cure (72 hours), the Loctiteâ„¢ seals against liquids and gases to pressures of 6,000 psi.

E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) Thin Wall solid threaded inserts use a modified external thread to reduce the hole diameter needed to achieve the desired internal thread size. To achieve this size reduction, these inserts have an oversized minor diameter on the OD thread. This provides sufficient wall thickness to maintain insert integrity, but does necessitate the use of a drill that is larger than typically used with the corresponding tap.

For example, a Standard Wall insert with a 5/8-11 external thread (7/16-14 ID) requires the use of a 17/32 drill. A Thin Wall insert with a 5/8-11 external thread (1/2-13 ID) requires the use of a 37/64 drill.

E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) Thin Wall inserts are self-locking. Immediately upon installation, pre-applied LOCTITEâ„¢ on the external threads begins to set and the newly installed insert is fastener ready in minutes. At full cure (72 hours), the Loctiteâ„¢ seals against liquids and gases to pressures of 6,000 psi.

Features

  • Ideal for applications where hole size is an issue
  • All the advantages of the standard E-Z LOK threaded inserts in a smaller overall diameter
  • Use standard tools for installation
  • Self-locking â€“ preapplied LOCTITEâ„¢ adhesive activates on installation
  • Vibration Resistant: adhesive secures the insert in place so it wonâ€™t back out

Applications:

  • Soft metals: aluminum, cast iron, magnesium, etc.

Installation:

Unlike E-Z Coilâ„¢ inserts, which require a special tap and installation tool, E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) threaded inserts for metal are installed using standard tools, and installation is as easy as 1-2-3.

  • Simply drill the appropriately sized hole with a standard drill
  • Tap the hole with a standard tap
  • Turn in the E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) insert like an ordinary fastener with a screwdriver, bolt and jam nut, or an E-Z LOKâ„¢ drive tool.


E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) threaded inserts are self-locking and open immediately upon installation. The pre-applied LOCTITEâ„¢ on the external threads sets immediately allowing for the newly installed insert to be fastener ready.

E-Z LOK solid wall threaded inserts are typically installed with the slots up. The slots accommodate a screwdriver or E-Z LOK drive tool. When using a bolt and jam nuts for installation, the slotted end of the insert can be either up or down.

Important Note: Hole size requirements may vary depending on a number of factors, including material and tools. We recommend you test your particular application before ordering. Contact us for free samples.

All solid construction E-Z LOK threaded inserts install with standard tools. No special drills...no special taps...no special installation tools.

E-Z LOKâ„¢ Threaded Insert for Metal - Screw Locking - Carbon Steel - 10-32 x 3/8-16

E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) Screw Locking Inserts are the standard heavy wall solid threaded inserts with thread locking adhesive on both the external and internal threads of the insert. The adhesive on the external threads secures the insert in place. The internal thread adhesive provides a screw locking feature that keeps fasteners from backing out.

Install these threaded inserts with a screwdriver or optional drive tool, allowing 3-5 minutes for the external thread adhesive to set up prior to threading in the fastener. A bolt can be used for installation as long as you do not intend to remove it. Removing the bolt after installation destroys adhesive effectiveness.

E-Z LOKâ„¢ Threaded Insert for Metal - Screw Locking - Carbon Steel - 1/4-20 x 7/16-14

E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) Screw Locking Inserts are the standard heavy wall solid threaded inserts with thread locking adhesive on both the external and internal threads of the insert. The adhesive on the external threads secures the insert in place. The internal thread adhesive provides a screw locking feature that keeps fasteners from backing out.

Install these threaded inserts with a screwdriver or optional drive tool, allowing 3-5 minutes for the external thread adhesive to set up prior to threading in the fastener. A bolt can be used for installation as long as you do not intend to remove it. Removing the bolt after installation destroys adhesive effectiveness.

E-Z LOKâ„¢ Threaded Insert for Metal - Screw Locking - Carbon Steel - 1/2-13 x 3/4-10

E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) Screw Locking Inserts are the standard heavy wall solid threaded inserts with thread locking adhesive on both the external and internal threads of the insert. The adhesive on the external threads secures the insert in place. The internal thread adhesive provides a screw locking feature that keeps fasteners from backing out.

Install these threaded inserts with a screwdriver or optional drive tool, allowing 3-5 minutes for the external thread adhesive to set up prior to threading in the fastener. A bolt can be used for installation as long as you do not intend to remove it. Removing the bolt after installation destroys adhesive effectiveness.

Features

  • Preapplied adhesive on ID threads provides screw locking feature
  • Self-Locking: preapplied adhesive activates upon installation

Installation:

Unlike E-Z Coilâ„¢ inserts, which require a special tap and installation tool, E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) threaded inserts for metal are installed using standard tools, and installation is as easy as 1-2-3.

  • Simply drill the appropriately sized hole with a standard drill

  • Turn in the E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) insert like an ordinary fastener with a screwdriver, bolt and jam nut, or an E-Z LOKâ„¢ drive tool.


E-Z LOKâ„¢ (Solid Wall) threaded inserts are self-locking and open immediately upon installation. The pre-applied LOCTITEâ„¢ on the external threads sets immediately allowing for the newly installed insert to be fastener ready.

E-Z LOK solid wall threaded inserts are typically installed with the slots up. The slots accommodate a screwdriver or E-Z LOK drive tool. When using a bolt and jam nuts for installation, the slotted end of the insert can be either up or down.

E-Z Pressâ„¢ Threaded Insert for Plastic - Flush - Brass - 0-80

E-Z Pressâ„¢ inserts are threaded inserts designed for post-molding installation in either thermoset plastics or thermoplastics. A slotted design with diamond-knurled OD allows for â€œcoldâ€� installation with optimum <a href="http://www.ezlok.com/download/PressInsertSpecSheet_2.pdf" title="torque/pull-out resistance">torque/pull-out resistance</a>. Cold installation of threaded inserts reduces the cost of moldings and eliminates the need to â€œchaseâ€� threads after molding.

Our E-Z Pressâ„¢ inserts are available in three styles: flush, flanged, and reverse slot. All three types press into place for fast, easy installation. Anything from a rubber mallet to an arbor press can be used for installation.

Features

  • Install cold
  • Reduce the cost of moldings
  • Cut reject waste caused by misaligned and faulty inserts
  • Eliminate the need to â€œchaseâ€� threads after molding
  • Install properly without a precise hole depth
  • Install properly without a precise hole depth

Applications:

  • Post-molding installation in either thermoset plastics or thermoplastics

Installation:



As the E-Z Pressâ„¢ insert is installed, it compresses slightly along the slot. As the fastener is threaded into place, the insert expands and the diamond knurl is pressed into the wall of the hole, securing the insert in place.

E-Z LOKâ„¢ 2-56 STI Tap

Although they operate in a similar fashion as â€œstandardâ€� taps, STI taps create an oversized thread specifically for E-Z Coilâ„¢ threaded inserts.

When installing the insert, the threads cut by the 2-56 STI tap mold the E-Z Coilâ„¢ insert into the desired thread size. These specific taps are ideal for tapping holes in soft metal material that require a strong threaded insert.

Manufactured from high speed steel (HSS), the 2-56 STI tap is designed for extreme durability. We offer these products in inch, metric and spark plug sizes to meet your specifications.

Features

  • These types of taps produce a larger than normal size threaded hole to house helical screw thread inserts.
  • They are ideal for E-Z Coil inserts

Applications:

Properly tapping the hole prior to installing an E-Z Coil threaded insert.
